title: API Design Principles
content:
Module 1, Lesson 8: API Design Principles

Introduction

This lesson covers API Design Principles, a core topic in The Web's DNA: HTTP, DNS, and Request/Response. Mastering this area will help you build reliable, scalable, and maintainable web applications.

Key Concepts

1. Fundamentals

Understanding the foundational principles of API Design Principles ensures you can apply them correctly in a variety of real-world scenarios. Always prefer clarity over cleverness.

2. Practical Application

Theory must translate into working code. In The Web's DNA: HTTP, DNS, and Request/Response, every concept has direct practical implications for how you architect, test, and deploy applications.

3. Common Pitfalls

Awareness of common mistakes in API Design Principles helps you avoid costly bugs and security vulnerabilities. Review real-world examples and practise defensive coding techniques.

4. Best Practices

Industry best practices evolve constantly. Keep up with community standards, read production post-mortems, and participate in code reviews to sharpen your skills in The Web's DNA: HTTP, DNS, and Request/Response.

Summary

You have completed API Design Principles in Module 1. Continue to the next lesson to build further expertise in The Web's DNA: HTTP, DNS, and Request/Response.
